{{multiple issues| {{Refimprove|date=June 2013}} {{Notability|Products|date=January 2013}} {{primary sources|date=January 2013}} {{advert|date=May 2013}} {{COI|date=May 2013}} }} {{Infobox software | name = OpenSIPS | logo = [[Image:OpenSIPS logo.png|frameless|OpenSIPS logo]] | developer = [[OpenSIPS Project]] | frequently updated = yes | released = {{Start date and age|df=yes|2008|08}} | latest release version = 1.9.1 | latest release date =
{{Start date and age|2013|05|08}}{{cite web |url=http://www.opensips.org/About/Version-1-9-0 |title=OpenSIPS 1.9 now available for production use |date=8 May 2013 |work=OpenSIPS 1.9 ChangeLog |publisher=OpenSIPS |accessdate=8 May 2013}} | status = Active | programming language = [[C (programming language)|C]] | operating system = [[Linux]], [[FreeBSD]], [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]] | genre = [[Voice over Internet Protocol]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]] | website = [http://www.opensips.org/ www.opensips.org] }} '''OpenSIPS''' is a fork of the [[OpenSER]] project, announced to the public on the 4th August 2008. The reason for this was conflict between the core developers. OpenSIPS concentrates on further development of the server. OpenSER maintenance and development will be done by the [[Kamailio]] project. ==Features== ===General=== {| |- | style="padding: 0 1.5em; text-align: justify;" | OpenSIPS has many important features. To mention some of the most important ones: * SIP registrar server * SIP router / proxy (lcr, dynamic routing, dialplan features) * SIP redirect server * SIP presence agent * SIP back-to-back User Agent * SIP IM server (chat and end-2-end IM) * SIP to SMS gateway (bidirectional) * SIP to XMPP gateway for presence and IM (bidirectional) * SIP load-balancer or dispatcher * SIP front end for gateways/asterisk * SIP NAT traversal unit * SIP application server |} ===Modules=== {| class="wikitable collapsible sortable" style="margin-left: 2em;" |+ OpenSIPS Current Modules |- ! style="background:lightblue; text-align:center;"|Name !! class="unsortable" style="background:lightblue;"|Description !! style="background:lightblue;"| Status !! style="background:lightblue;"| Available from version |- ! style="text-align:left; padding-left: 10px; padding-right: 10px; white-space:nowrap;"|XMPP | style="text-align:left; padding-left: 10px; padding-right: 10px; white-space:nowrap;"|SIP-to-XMPP Gateway (SIP to Jabber/Google Talk) | style="text-align:center; background:lightgreen; white-space:nowrap;"| stable | style="text-align:center; white-space:nowrap;"| 1.4 |} ===Upcoming features=== # NEW DB_CACHEDB module #* SQL to NoSQL conversions - it provides the SQL API while directly operating with a noSQL engine. Thus, any OpenSIPS module that would regularly need a regular SQL-based database, will now be able to run over a NoSQL back-end, allowing for a much easier distribution and integration of the currently existing OpenSIPS modules in a distributed environment. # NEW MATHOPS module #* Floating point arithmetic at OpenSIPS script level, along with a series of rounding capabilities # NEW MI_XMLRPC_NG module #* Improved XMLRPC support - Dropped the libxmlrpc-c3 library. Uses the "httpd" module as an HTTP server engine. # NEW REST_CLIENT module #* HTTP GET and POST are currently the methods supported by the new HTTP client module. Read More... # NEW Transformations #* hex2dec and dec2hex transformations, used for conversions between decimal and hexadecimal numbers. # AVPOPS module #* avp_db_load() - new optional "avp name prefix" parameter which allows distiction between identical attributes when loading AVPs from the database. # B2B_LOGIC module #* NEW custom_header_regexp param - Regexp to search SIP header by names that should be passed from the dialog of one side to the other side. # CACHE_LOCAL module #* Remove Chunks - have the ability to remove entire chunks of the cache, from the MI and Script level # DB_HTTP module #* NEW timeout param - limit the number of milliseconds that a query is allowed to last # DIALOG module #* $DLG_end_reason - new PVAR to tell you the way how to dialog ended ( either normal termination, FIFO, media timeout, lifetime expire, etc ) #* dlg_restore_db - new MI command which truncates and repopulates the dialog table with the currently confirmed dialogs in memory # HTTPD module #* POST support added (additional to GET support) - this will open the way for the migration of mi_xmlrpc module and other new features. # REGISTRAR module #* Store information per location entry - the 'attr_avp' module parameter is used to specify an avp which will be used to store/load additional registration-related information in/from the location table. # RTPPROXY module #* NEW rtpp_sock_pvar parameter - expose to the script the actual RTPProxy URI used in the case of multiple RTPProxy instances load balancing # USRLOC module #* AOR insert and delete events - the usrloc module raises events when a new AOR is inserted or deleted. This allows you to build custom applications to track the customers. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{external links|date=May 2013}} {{Portal|Free software}} * [http://www.opensips.org/ OpenSIPS homepage] * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/opensips/ OpenSIPS Project on SF] * [https://github.com/OpenSIPS/opensips OpenSIPS Project on GitHub ] * [http://www.voip-info.org/wiki/view/OpenSIPS Voip-Info.org ] * [http://code.google.com/p/homer/wiki/OpenSIPS OpenSIPS Homer Capture Server ] * [http://blog.2600hz.com/post/16929919248/under-the-hood-opensips-and-freeswitch OpenSIPS & FreeSwitch ] * [http://www.voiptoday.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=231:asterisk VoIP Today ] * [http://kb.smartvox.co.uk/opensips/opensips-explained/ What is OpenSIPS ] {{DEFAULTSORT:Opensips}} [[Category:VoIP software]] [[Category:Free VoIP software]]
